tasks.task: Women farmers gaining recognition and improving their socioeconomic status through technological adoption.
subtasks: Discuss women farmers in Bihar, India.
Explain the lack of recognition and agricultural access prior to ERI's intervention.
Describe the introduction of machine transplanting and direct seeding.
Detail the time and energy savings from using new technologies.
Highlight increased confidence and better household management.
Mention the formation of a self-help group to purchase a machine transplanter.
Report on custom hiring services offered by the women farmers.
Discuss the impact on community recognition and respect.
Address cultural barriers (patriarchal norms) and persistence.
Outline broader effects on women's roles and decision-making.
Emphasize the role of collective action in overcoming social norms.
Note gains in access to inputs, technologies, land, and financial instruments.
Conclude on the positive changes in power dynamics and socioeconomic status.
